meanings.definition: A thing or things belonging to someone.
meanings.sent1: My friend's property includes a bike and a skateboard.
meanings.sent2: She takes good care of her property by keeping it clean and organized.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mistook my neighbor's cat for my own property!
meanings.sent4: Her smile is her most valuable property, lighting up any room she enters.
meanings.sent5: The old mansion stood as a symbol of wealth and property in the town.

meanings.definition: A quality or characteristic of something.
meanings.sent1: Honesty is a valuable property in a good friend.
meanings.sent2: The property of the fabric allows it to stretch without tearing.
meanings.sent3: The property of the magic potion was that it made people dance uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a property that set her apart from the rest.
meanings.sent5: The property of the diamond was its incredible sparkle and clarity.

meanings.definition: An attribute or characteristic of a substance.
meanings.sent1: The flammability property of the chemical made it dangerous to handle.
meanings.sent2: Water's unique property of expanding when frozen helps ice float.
meanings.sent3: The property of the rubber ball was that it bounced higher than any other.
meanings.sent4: The property of the perfume was its long-lasting floral scent.
meanings.sent5: The property of the magnet to attract metal fascinated the children.
